item.title: Designing GraphQL schemas
item.description: This post made it to top 10 on HackerNews front page. Do engage in discussion there and show us love by giving us a GitHub star.

item.title: Getting started with Dgraph-8: Easily build location-aware apps using our native geolocation features
item.description: Welcome to the eighth episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the previous episode, we learned about building a twitter-like user-search feature using Dgraph’s fuzzy search.

item.title: Getting started with Dgraph tutorials series - 7: Give your users powerful search results with fuzzy search on graph
item.description: Welcome to the seventh episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the previous episode, we learned about building advanced text searches on social graphs in Dgraph, by modeling tweets as an example.

item.title: Whatâ€™s Next? Learn Dgraph with the Getting-Started Blog Series
item.description: We are excited to announce that the “Get Started with Dgraph” of our documentation site now includes the episodes from our getting started blog series.

item.title: Getting started with Dgraph tutorials series - 6: Advanced text search on social graphs
item.description: Welcome to the sixth episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the previous episode, we learned about building social graphs in Dgraph, by modeling tweets as an example.

item.title: Getting started with Dgraph tutorials series - 5: Tweet graph, string indices, and keyword-based searching
item.description: Welcome to the fifth episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the previous episode, we learned about using multi-language strings and operations on them using language tags.

item.title: Getting started with Dgraph tutorials series - 4: Multi-language strings
item.description: Welcome to the fourth episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the previous episode, we learned about Datatypes, Indexing, Filtering, and Reverse traversals in Dgraph.

item.title: Dgraph tutorials series - 3: Datatypes, Indexing, Filtering, and Reverse traversals.
item.description: Welcome to the third episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the previous episode of the tutorial, we learned about the CRUD operations using UIDs.

item.title: Dgraph tutorials series - 2: UID operations, updating nodes, and traversals
item.description: Welcome to the second episode of getting started with Dgraph. In the last episode of the tutorial, we learned some of the basics of Dgraph.

item.title: Dgraph tutorials series - 1: Getting started
item.description: Welcome to getting started with Dgraph. Dgraph is an open-source, transactional, distributed, native Graph Database. Here is the first episode of the tutorial series on using Dgraph.

item.title: Building a To-Do List React App with Dgraph
item.description: In this tutorial we will build a To-Do List application using React JavaScript library and Dgraph as a backend database.
